headline: Global earnings show shift from US as S&P 500 slumped
summary: While profits boomed in the US, the rest of the world wasn’t shabby either, undergirding calls to diversify away from American stocks into megacaps in Asia and Europe.  Asia’s behemoths continued to benefit from their key role in the artificial intelligence build out, while European consumer companies remained under pressure.

headline: Zevia PBC Q4 Earnings Call Highlights
summary: Zevia PBC (NYSE:ZVIA) executives said the company made “transformation progress” in 2025, pointing to improved profitability metrics, expanded distribution, and a stepped-up innovation and marketing pipeline heading into 2026. headline: Does Walmart Have a Durable Competitive Advantage?
summary: Walmart's scale is undeniable, but is its competitive advantage truly built to last?

headline: Is CEO Change And Rating Cut Altering The Investment Case For Kroger (KR)?
summary: In late February 2026, Wells Fargo reduced its rating on The Kroger Co. to Equal Weight, citing spending concerns and muted near-term growth, just as Kroger named former Walmart executive Greg Foran as its new CEO following a board investigation and a failed US$25.00 billion Albertsons acquisition attempt. These developments highlight a period of leadership transition and heightened scrutiny of Kroger’s capital allocation and expansion plans at a time of intense grocery competition. Now...

headline: Walmart (WMT) Coverage Reinstated With Bullish Outlook from BofA
summary: Walmart Inc. (NASDAQ:WMT) is included among the 13 Best March Dividend Stocks to Buy. On February 27, BofA reinstated coverage of Walmart Inc. (NASDAQ:WMT) with a Buy rating. The firm set a price target of $150 on the stock. The analyst said Walmart continues to gain market share, especially among higher-income consumers, helped by faster […]

headline: Walmart FTC Settlement Puts Gig Worker Pay And Valuation In Focus
summary: Walmart (NasdaqGS:WMT) agreed to pay US$100 million to settle a lawsuit with the Federal Trade Commission and 11 states over alleged deceptive practices involving delivery driver pay and tips. The settlement requires Walmart to change how it communicates driver compensation, improve earnings verification, and adhere to new pay transparency and reporting rules for gig workers. The agreement introduces ongoing FTC oversight of Walmart’s compliance with the new standards around driver pay and...
